frameDefinitions: This frame concerns the decorations that human beings have on or apply to their bodies.
One phenomenon, the Predictive_phenomenon is an indication of the future or current (but still uncertain) existence of another phenomenon, the Future_phenomenon.
The Support, a phenomenon or fact,  lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the Proposition, where the Domain_of_relevance may also be expressed.
These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source.
A phenomenon, the Indicator, exists as an indication of another phenomenon, the Indicated.
frameExamples: The latest poll results <t>show</t> that support of the president is at an all-time low.
I can't believe he <t>pickpocketed</t> my gold watch !
This is a <t>sign</t> of things to come.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Decoration</fen> is the decorative item that adorns the body.
<fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen> provides evidence for the existence or the nature of the <fen>Outcome</fen> of <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is that phenomenon that is predicted to occur or have a particular quality.
The role <fen>Outcome</fen> identifies those expressions that indicate how the <fen>Future_phenomenon</fen> is expected to turn out based on the evidence of the <fen>Predictive_phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the omen is occuring.
The location where something good or bad might occur.
Support is a fact that lends epistemic support to a claim, or that provides a reason for a course of action. Typically it is expressed as an External Argument.
This is a belief, claim, or proposed course of action to which the Support lends validity. Normally it is expressed as a Finite Clause Complement:
A force, process, or event that produces an effect.
Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)
A positive or negative evaluation of the Phenomenon.
An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
<fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away.
<fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.
<fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the theft occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the theft occurs.
The phenomenon that signifies the <fen>Indicated</fen>.
The phenomenon that is signified by the <fen>Indicator</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Abby has a <fex>tattoo</fex> on her thigh.
<fex>To achieve so much this year</fex> augurs well for the future.
This move presages <fex>a freeze on the granting of new concessions</fex>.
It all bodes <fex>well</fex> for the future.
The storm bodes ill for you <fex>here</fex> .
<fex>The fact that you lied to me</fex> shows that I shouldn't trust you.
The fact that you lied to me shows <fex>that I shouldn't trust you</fex>.
<fex>That one stone</fex>, apparently, caused the avalanche that engulfed square miles of forest.
Leslie stole the watch <fex>from the table</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>at dusk</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>in the park</fex>.
He was unable to display any <fex>sign</fex> of pain.
We now exhibt the same symptoms <fex>of the same disease</fex>.
